title: Welcome!
text:
Selvin Carrillo is currently a Ph.D. student in the Department of Horticulture at the University of Georgia. His research focuses on enhancing peach orchard management practices such as mineral nutrition, root phenotyping, irrigation scheduling, and rootstock-scion water and nutrient dynamics in peaches. These projects are under the supervision of Dr. Dario Chavez Chavez Lab.
Selvin Carrillo was born in Guatemala, where he earned a bachelor’s degree in Agronomy at the University of San Carlos and a specialization in Agricultural Research endorsed by the partnership ICTA-CUNOC-IICA/CRIA. Before graduate school, he did an internship through the Worldwide Farmers Exchange Program, and worked at the Inter-American Institute for Cooperation on Agriculture (IICA), the Institute of Science and Agricultural Technologies, and the Farmer-to-Farmer Program implemented by Partners of the Americas. He then completed a master’s degree in Crop Science at North Carolina State University working in heat stress.
